subtitle: Hello, I’m Jeffrey Mishlove, and today I’d like to talk about PSI
Development Systems. Well, PSI Development Systems is the name of my second book - you can see the cover there in the
paperback edition. It went through two editions. The first was a hardbound, published in
1981, I believe it was, and the second was the paperback that came out in
1987. Well, this book is actually based on my doctoral dissertation at Berkeley. Some people have
mistakenly thought that The Roots of Consciousness was my doctoral dissertation.
But, in effect The Roots of Consciousness – the most popular book I’ve written – was
published as the equivalent of a qualifying exam, or to let my
faculty committee at Berkley, when I was a doctoral student in parapsychology, know that I was prepared to take a
qualifying exam. In other words, that I had a real strong
understanding of the background, an overview of the field of parapsychology
and related areas. And then my passion was to explore the
field of psychic training.
How do you take the average person, and develop their psychic abilities? And so, PSI
Development Systems was also the name of my doctoral dissertation.
In it I looked at historical
approaches, including shamanism,
yoga, many different
approaches that were part of spiritual traditions
essentially. I looked at contemporary popular approaches, things like
“Silva Mind Control” and a couple of dozen different programs that were offered through
institutes like the Berkeley Psychic Institute, or various individuals
who had psychic talents had their own training programs, and I surveyed those.
Then, I looked at the experimental literature of parapsychology to see what it also
contributed. So, when you combine these – the historical approaches, the contemporary
popular approaches, the experimental approaches – there were dozens of
approaches to training psychic abilities that I examined. I attempted to break them down,
to see what they were doing, what was their method, what was their secret,
so to speak.
Unfortunately, there wasn’t any really good data to show that any of them had
actual success, because, well for one thing, most of them never
endeavored to measure that. A few of them did and the results weren’t particularly promising. Then, what I also
did in the summer of
1977 is I conducted my own
program in training remote viewing
abilities. I had had quite a bit of success in remote viewing training up until that time. But, here’s the intriguing thing:
what I discovered was that it’s easy to have success if you do a short program – like a
weekend program training remote viewing – because I guess you could call it beginner’s luck, or
simply the ability of a naive
person to do remote viewing. It’s not that hard at all. People who are well-adjusted,
successful adults typically do quite well on the first trial.
One of those programs I ran some time ago, we had a reporter from one of the newspapers in
Chicago. I was doing a weekend program with my wife Janelle training remote viewing and this reporter showed up and
went through the program and had a direct hit on
a complex target –
we were in a cemetery at the time, as I recall – and wrote a big story up
about it, a big spread in one of the Sunday news magazines
in Chicago. But, what I found was –
essentially back in
1977 it was a bit ahead of the times, especially because, after I graduated with my doctoral degree in
parapsychology,
I was libeled and felt mortified and was not willing to really put myself out there into the
public space when I knew anybody could go and say, “Look, here’s this magazine article. It says you’re incompetent.”
And how am I to deal with that?
Until I won the libel suit,
eventually – or at least it was settled favorably on my behalf –
then I began rebuilding my reputation and rebuilding my life
and it was actually at that time that I started the Thinking Allowed television series.
But now – can you imagine, some forty years later –
I’m beginning to take another look at my work in psi
development. One of the things I realize, looking at all of these systems – what did they have in common?
What was one of the most
important features? I’ll tell you, I think it is a
social environment providing positive feedback and support for people.
Now, what I did in the summer of
1977 was run an eight-week training program, where we tested people once a week for eight weeks on
remote viewing skills. We spent everyday together for eight weeks,
so it was very intense – you know, four or five hours a day, five days a week, for eight weeks –
but at the end of the day, given that the
empirical measurement was a remote viewing test, what I found was that people scored quite
well the very first week. Then what happened is,
as the
consequences of doing well in remote viewing began to sink in there were a lot of emotions that came up for people and
difficulty in accepting
this as an integral part of their life and the scores declined.
Then, over time, I would say the scores dropped for about the first three to four weeks,
and then they began to slowly build back up, so at the end of the eighth week people were
doing about as well as they had in the first week. But, the only way to make sense of that data was to
evaluate it through
what was known in the
statistical literature as a “J curve,” that the scores start high, drop low and then move back up again.
As a consequence of that,
it’s occurred to me that what’s really required if we want to have a
society where people can cultivate their various psychic capacities the same way people are encouraged to develop their
mathematical abilities, their
athletic
abilities, their speaking
abilities, acting, music, art abilities – all of these things are widely supported in the culture. But, psychic
abilities are not. What I’d like to create, what I’m thinking about creating, is a
special vehicle for people who wish to
be part of a community where there’s support and encouragement for becoming more psychic. Now,
I know in a way the whole New Thinking Allowed video series does exactly that – I’ve uploaded
over six-hundred
individual videos supporting the reality of psychic functioning and related
functioning in many, many different ways. But, I’m now thinking of
doing something a bit more, something that would involve mentoring and coaching.
I don’t know exactly the form it will take, but I have created a little
questionnaire that I’m linking to now – you’ll see a link in the upper-right [corner] of your screen –
so that those of you who are viewing this “In Presence” segment could answer a couple of questions
to help me consider whether to take this
possibility to another level, to revive the work
I began over forty years ago with Psi Development Systems.
I’m kind of thinking along the lines of Dr. Xavier of the X-Men, in his
Institute for Higher Learning, because it occurs to me that not everybody is interested in
remote viewing. I mean, it’s a great model for
psychic training: it involves clairvoyance, it’s being pursued by some
interesting groups for financial forecasting in particular –
but Dr. Xavier’s model
from the Marvel comic book series talks about working with many different people who have many different, diverse
talents, each one unique, each one special. For example, my friend Janice,
whom I referred to a few days ago in an “In Presence”
monologue, was great at finding four-leaf clovers, but not so good at remote viewing. So
this is a thought of mine. I am thinking of taking this to a new level, and I would very much appreciate,
for those of you who have an interest in
taking your own development to a new level, to get some feedback from you. So, I hope you’ll
seriously look at the little questionnaire. If you do, you’ll be able to see the answers provided by other
viewers. I will
review the comments seriously, and it may well be that in the coming weeks and months
I will unfold some new possibilities in addition to everything else you can find
on the New Thinking Allowed channel, for people who would like to
participate
at a deeper level yet with regard to psi development.
Thank you for giving this your consideration, and thank you for being with me.
